TITLE.P: Framework agreement for the development of ICT systems for the Directorate of agriculture 2018

SHORT_DESCR.P: The framework agreement for development shall give the Directorate of agriculture, (hereafter called the contracting authority), access to professional and correct competence within the digitalisation and development of services and systems for the directorate.

The framework agreement for development shall give the Directorate of agriculture, (hereafter called the contracting authority), access to professional and correct competence within the digitalisation and development of services and systems for the directorate.
The contract is for the following services:
1. Development of new systems and services;

The development of new systems and services will be relevant when the contracting authority must modernise or replace older trade systems due to capacity or technological challenges, or when the contracting authority has received new assignments or responsibilities for new policies, possibly with new user groups, or when changes to the rules and administration model are so comprehensive that they cannot be realised by adaptations to the existing system.

The review and analysis activities will consist of minor assignments such as reviews, projects and analyses that the contracting authority would like the Tenderer to carry out and that are not a direct part of the other development service. Relevant services will be, for example, technical consultancy services, reviews or analyses within mapping needs, choice of architecture, choice of technology or system alternatives.
The contract shall ensure and contribute to:
— the contracting authority having access to the correct resources with the correct competence at the correct time,
— the development being carried out professionally, efficiently and with high quality and professional standard,
— good interaction and clear responsibility between the contracting authority's suppliers within development, maintenance and operation,
— development being carried out in accordance with flexible principles.

Attention is drawn to the fact that this procurement is the first of 3 that will be announced in the first part of 2018 that will cover development, maintenance and operation of the contracting authority's ICT systems.

INFO_ADD.P: If a tenderer finds that tender documentation does not provide adequate guidance, he can request additional information from the contracting authority’s contact person. Notification of any errors found in the tender documentation should be sent to the contracting authority’s contact person.
See Part VI.3 and Annex 1 of the tender documentation for further details.

TITLE.P: Framework agreement for the development of ICT systems for the Directorate of Agriculture 2018

INFO_ADD.P: If the tenderer finds that tender documentation does not provide adequate guidance, a written request for additional information can be submitted to the contracting authority’s contact person.
Written notification of any errors found in the tender documentation should be sent to the contracting authority’s contact person.
Written enquiries on additional information are to marked with “Tender Contest, ref: 18856” and sent to the contracting authority's contact person via the electronic tool.
If there are discrepancies between the information given in the tender documentation and the information in the tender management tool, it is the information in the tender documentation that applies.
See Annex 1 of the tender documentation for further details.
